prompt: The Third Battle of Panipat (1761) was fought between?
explanation: Third Battle of Panipat (1761) was between the Marathas and Ahmad Shah Abdali; Marathas were defeated.

prompt: Nadir Shah invaded India and sacked Delhi in?
explanation: Nadir Shah of Persia invaded in 1739, defeated the Mughals, and looted Delhi (including the Peacock Throne).

prompt: The Peshwa became the de facto head of the Maratha confederacy from the time of?
answers: Balaji Vishwanath / Baji Rao I onwards
explanation: Under Balaji Vishwanath and Baji Rao I, the Peshwa at Pune became the central authority of the Maratha confederacy.

prompt: Baji Rao I is known for?
explanation: Baji Rao I (1720–40) expanded Maratha power northwards; he said he would strike the Mughal crown.

answers: Declined; regional states (Awadh, Bengal, Hyderabad, Marathas) grew
explanation: Later Mughals ruled in name only; nawabs of Awadh, Bengal, and Nizams of Hyderabad became virtually independent.

prompt: Ahmad Shah Abdali was the ruler of?
explanation: Ahmad Shah Abdali (Durrani) ruled Afghanistan and raided North India; he won at Panipat in 1761.
Bahadur Shah Zafar II was the last Mughal emperor; he was exiled after 1857.

prompt: Tipu Sultan was the ruler of?
explanation: Tipu Sultan ruled Mysore; he fought the British and was killed in 1799.

prompt: Haider Ali was the father of?
explanation: Haider Ali was the ruler of Mysore; his son Tipu Sultan succeeded him.

prompt: Third Battle of Panipat (1761) was between?
Peshwa became de facto head of Maratha confederacy from?
answers: Balaji Vishwanath / Baji Rao I onwards
explanation: Balaji Vishwanath and Baji Rao I.
